commit_message:
Change transaction isolation so retry logic could work properly

Lower isolation level from REPEATABLE READ to READ COMMITTED for
transaction that is used to create a network.
This allows retry logic to see changes done in other connections
while doing the same query.
Perform that only for mysql db backend.

Change-Id: I6b9d9212c37fe028566e0df4a3dfa51f284ce6e9
Closes-Bug: #1382064
(cherry picked from commit 6617f8fccc8d99520a87cd84a598c4f9a1a43761)

commit_message:
Allow an empty region list

If the AVAILABLE_REGIONS list is empty, treat it the same as if
it wasn't specified at all. This is needed for when we can't
leave out a setting from configuration, in oslo_config.

Change-Id: I97552894e1f9c4312e64ec882ac604bae3b16b55
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/django_openstack_auth refs/changes/29/147129/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: regions = getattr(settings, 'AVAILABLE_REGIONS') if not regions: regions = [default_region] return regions

commit_message:
Add support for instance vif traffic control.

Part 2 for blueprint quota-instance-resource, by adding exposed params
"vif_inbound_average, vif_inbound_burst, vif_inbound_peak,
vif_outbound_average, vif_outbound_burst, vif_outbound_peak" through
nova flavor-set, user can implement instance net traffic control policy.
for example:
nova flavor-set m1.medium set vif_inbound_average=10240000,
then the max inbound speed is 10MB/s. The usecase details of other params
will be noted on openstack-manuals.

Partly implement blueprint quota-instance-resource
DocImpact
original reviews https://review.openstack.org/#/c/14151/

Change-Id: I9934daadbf0e136e88530f5c23b556d070395bd0

commit_message:
Move tempest_roles options to auth group

This commit moves the tempest_roles option to the auth group. This
option was previously in the identity section which was the incorrect
place for it. The identity group is used for config settings related
to keystone, while the auth section is used for tempest specific user
auth.

Change-Id: Id89c7c265b648cf31b3f2e684d4467a7c8c2f554

Add missing oslo-config to requirements

openstackclient uses these oslo-config but it is not in
list of requirements. That results in a stacktrace while
using the cli.

commit_message:
Restrict application count in "Recent Activity"

In Juno release app tile design been changed.
And now 6 applications in latest apps sections look bulky.
This patch sets app count to 3, so one just one line of
apps will be used by "recent activity" section


Change-Id: Idee84a5b62f7e920b2a7969f5b43107545b20414
Closes-Bug: #1405216

commit_message:
Verify the instance's existance in the VMAX driver

There are a few functions in the VMAX driver that are
referencing an instance that may have been already deleted.
This patch addressed this issue by verifying the instance's
existance.

Closes-Bug: #1393555
Change-Id: Id2aa0e892189d565d092c1c18c2e6dadc580f765

commit_message:
invalidate cache when updating catalog objects

Currently, we forgot invalidate cache when updating service, region,
endpoint successfully.

Closes-Bug: #1403277
Change-Id: I3ed2aa916caabda9b94a7c31564413aa81b603d3
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/keystone refs/changes/79/142079/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: @tests.skip_if_cache_disabled('catalog') def test_invalidate_cache_when_updating_region(self): region_id = uuid.uuid4().hex new_region = { 'id': region_id, 'description': uuid.uuid4().hex } self.catalog_api.create_region(new_region) self.catalog_api.get_region(region_id) new_description = {'description': uuid.uuid4().hex} self.catalog_api.update_region(region_id, new_description) current_region = self.catalog_api.get_region(region_id) self.assertEqual(new_description['description'], current_region['description']) self.catalog_api.driver.update_service(service_id, updated_service) @tests.skip_if_cache_disabled('catalog') def test_invalidate_cache_when_updating_service(self): service_id = uuid.uuid4().hex new_service = { 'id': service_id, 'type': uuid.uuid4().hex, 'name': uuid.uuid4().hex, 'description': uuid.uuid4().hex, } self.catalog_api.create_service( service_id, new_service.copy()) self.catalog_api.get_service(service_id) new_type = {'type': uuid.uuid4().hex} self.catalog_api.update_service(service_id, new_type) current_service = self.catalog_api.get_service(service_id) self.assertEqual(new_type['type'], current_service['type']) @tests.skip_if_cache_disabled('catalog') def test_invalidate_cache_when_updating_endpoint(self): service = { 'id': uuid.uuid4().hex, 'type': uuid.uuid4().hex, 'name': uuid.uuid4().hex, 'description': uuid.uuid4().hex, } self.catalog_api.create_service(service['id'], service) # create an endpoint attached to the service endpoint_id = uuid.uuid4().hex endpoint = { 'id': endpoint_id, 'region_id': None, 'interface': uuid.uuid4().hex[:8], 'url': uuid.uuid4().hex, 'service_id': service['id'], } self.catalog_api.create_endpoint(endpoint_id, endpoint) self.catalog_api.get_endpoint(endpoint_id) new_url = {'url': uuid.uuid4().hex} self.catalog_api.update_endpoint(endpoint_id, new_url) current_endpoint = self.catalog_api.get_endpoint(endpoint_id) self.assertEqual(new_url['url'], current_endpoint['url'])

commit_message:
correct the help text of os_inherit

Now, inherited role-assignment also can be from projects higher
in the hierarchy.

commit_message:
Identify groups by name/domain in mapping rules.

Add a mechanism that allows for building federation mapping groups
where a local group is identified by a name and a domain.
If the group doesn't exist corresponding exceptions will be raised.

Partially-Implements: bp mapping-enhancements
Change-Id: I67e3c0f1d91fa1e85a1f850f73d04db367ea27e1
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/keystone refs/changes/13/139013/17 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def extract_groups(groups_by_domain): for groups in groups_by_domain.values(): yield {group['name']: group for group in groups}.values() group_names = list() if 'groups' in identity_value: groups_by_domain = dict() for group in identity_value['groups']: domain = (group['domain'].get('name') or group['domain'].get('id')) groups_by_domain.setdefault(domain, list()).append(group) group_names = extract_groups(groups_by_domain) return {'name': user_name, 'group_ids': list(group_ids), 'group_names': list(group_names)}

commit_message:
Fix up types within API documentation

Correct the type signature of some API documentation. Add inter-sphinx
mapping to documentation to provide links to external docs. Correct some
phrases and errors.

Change-Id: Id4a71a9901e5adc695afed656e3bc84e4e54e67a

commit_message:
Fixes bootstrap tests

The existing test_bootstrap test didn't actually test anything. The
called_anytime function would return a False, but nothing would turn
that into an error.

Change-Id: I32aab4dc80e6701abc70e34d8511c1008dadd2e0
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/python-keystoneclient refs/changes/18/147618/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: from oslo.serialization import jsonutils test_url = self.TEST_URL.strip('/') if not r.url == test_url + path: raise AssertionError('URL never called') {"role": {"name": "admin"}})
deleted_lines: if not r.url == self.TEST_URL + path: return False {"role": {"name": "new-role"}})

and vice versa. This patch fixes the API to match
the implementation.

added_lines: Configure congress:: (Assume you put config files in /etc/congress) $ sudo mkdir -p /etc/congress $ sudo mkdir -p /etc/congress/snapshot $ sudo cp etc/api-paste.ini /etc/congress $ sudo cp etc/policy.json /etc/congress $ sudo cp etc/congress.conf.sample /etc/congress/congress.conf $ sudo cp etc/datasources.conf.sample /etc/congress/datasources.conf Add two lines in /etc/congress/congress.conf [DEFAULT] section: policy_path = /etc/congress/snapshot datasource_file=/etc/congress/datasources.conf Modify [keystone_authtoken] and [database] according to your environment. $ sudo congress-db-manage --config-file /path/to/congress.conf upgrade head Setup congress accounts:: (You should change parameters according to your environment) $ ADMIN_ROLE=$(openstack role list | awk "/ admin / { print \$2 }") $ SERVICE_TENANT=$(openstack project list | awk "/ admin / { print \$2 }") $ CONGRESS_USER=$(openstack user create --password password --project admin \ --email "congress@example.com" congress) $ openstack role add $ADMIN_ROLE --user $CONGRESS_USER --project \ $SERVICE_TENANT $ CONGRESS_SERVICE=$(openstack service create congress --type "policy" \ --description "Congress Service") $ openstack endpoint create $CONGRESS_SERVICE \ --region RegionOne \ --publicurl http://127.0.0.1:1789/ \ --adminurl http://127.0.0.1:1789/ \ --internalurl http://127.0.0.1:1789/ Start congress:: $ sudo /usr/local/bin/congress-server --debug

commit_message:
Use error.message in error response

Openstack apiclient exception requires an error json object and
its 'message' field will be used to construct output error message.
The output is not pretty but has the detail and works for all
congressclient commands.

Change-Id: I881f2579c147fb25e7669282a6e5f9be889e3baf
Closes-Bug: #1368462

commit_message:
Remove python-migrate

python-migrate pulls in python-decorator on Ubuntu and something allows
that (version 3.3.2) to not get upgraded to 3.4.0 which is on our
requirements.txt.

See if we can get migrate from pip...

Change-Id: Iacf2f67a33fb82895cef8b1af2d1b701a020efe3

subject: Rename driver mode to dynamic_svm_mode and no_svm mode
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-12-30 00:16:36.000000000', 'files': ['manila/tests/fake_driver.py', 'manila/tests/share/drivers/test_generic.py', 'manila/tests/share/test_driver.py', 'manila/common/constants.py', 'manila/share/drivers/generic.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/manila/commit/d85ddaf65215f79fd55b03e387db0da0d9e9734b', 'message': 'Rename driver mode to dynamic_svm_mode and no_svm mode

There are two driver modes currently, multi_svm_mode
and single_svm_mode.

"multi_svm_mode" means usage of share-networks that contain
network info for dynamic creation of share-servers (SVMs).
"single_svm_mode" means usage of predefined some endpoint,
without need to provide share-network and without creation
of share-servers (SVMs).

User might easily get wrong ideas about these driver modes based
on their names. "multi_svm_mode" sounds like more than one
share-servers are needed, and "single_svm_mode" indicate only one
share-server is enough.

We'd like to rename driver mode names:
  - multi_svm_mode    =>  dynamic_svm_mode
  - single_svm_mode   =>  no_svm_mode

Change-Id: Ib25fe4b42675f53d00608209ec20a1daed2b7446
'}]
commit_message:
Rename driver mode to dynamic_svm_mode and no_svm mode

There are two driver modes currently, multi_svm_mode
and single_svm_mode.

"multi_svm_mode" means usage of share-networks that contain
network info for dynamic creation of share-servers (SVMs).
"single_svm_mode" means usage of predefined some endpoint,
without need to provide share-network and without creation
of share-servers (SVMs).

User might easily get wrong ideas about these driver modes based
on their names. "multi_svm_mode" sounds like more than one
share-servers are needed, and "single_svm_mode" indicate only one
share-server is enough.

We'd like to rename driver mode names:
  - multi_svm_mode    =>  dynamic_svm_mode
  - single_svm_mode   =>  no_svm_mode

Change-Id: Ib25fe4b42675f53d00608209ec20a1daed2b7446

commit_message:
increase fake rpc POLL_TIMEOUT to 0.1s

The 0.001s POLL_TIMEOUT appeared related to an intermitent race
issue. The polling loop in the fake driver in oslo.messaging is 0.05s,
so increase to 0.1 total time out to make sure we get at least one
full polling cycle on waits.

Change-Id: I24a83638df0c8f3f84bb528333a91491a98016a3
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/69/147969/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # substantially. It should be > 0.05, because we've seen races # that happen if this is less than the internal polling # timeout in oslo.messaging. 0.1))

commit_message:
create some unit of work logging in n-net

n-net was logging everything at DEBUG level, this creates some unit of
work logging at INFO for init_host, allocating networks, and
deallocating networks.

Part of bp:log-guidelines

Change-Id: I66174f98d1317df4b74bfe20e4bc6c008d0fa15c

commit_message:
clean mysql better

The purge that was previously removed was actually kind of important
to burning mysql back down to a stateless zero point. Bring this back
with the addition of doing it for mariadb as well.

Change-Id: If608db8731d9ddfb2440a37387409798619b163c
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/devstack refs/changes/09/147209/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: apt_get purge -y mysql* mariadb*

commit_message:
Add the context benchmark_image

Add a new context with the name 'benchmark_image'. This context is
hidden and acts as the base for the contexts of the virtual machine
benchmark scenarios.
This context generates an image that has installed all the required
programs needed for the execution of the specified benchmark.

Implements: blueprint benchmark-vms
Change-Id: I7848ca3f037305a2c0700fb4b4b137d8e72475a8

commit_message:
Adding duration header to rally verify list query

A new duration column is added to the result of "rally verify list" query
It depicts the time for which the verification ran

Change-Id: I6027634425ffd9b4e4217fda692dcc3972518360

commit_message:
Add unstable job file + return SLA for boot from volume

Now we have unstable job (that is non-voting)

*) From one side we can get job -1 vote for benchmarks
that has races and track status of them + ensure
that they works at least somethimes.

*) From other side we don't block our gates

As well put back SLA checks related to booting from volume
functionallity, that was fixed in nova.

Change-Id: Ia716abcef0e903151053effa3c50df4b0e78649d

commit_message:
Catch expected exceptions in remote console controller

Remote console controllers (both V2 & V2.1), does not catch
all the expected exceptions which results to raise HTTPInternalServerError.

This patch catches all the expected exceptions in those controllers.
Also share serial_console tests among V2 & V2.1

Change-Id: Iea706eb45b0f2f6cdfd7e8d6061cad03ab43c6ee

commit_message:
Make changes such that -o nounset runs

This makes a bunch of variable cleanups that will let -o nounset
function, for the time being we hide nounset behind another setting
variable so that it's not on by default.

Because this is bash, and things are only executed on demand, this
probably only works in the config it was run in. Expect cleaning up
all the paths to be something that takes quite a while.

This also includes a new set of unit tests around the trueorfalse
function, because my change in how it worked, didn't. Tests are good
m'kay.

Change-Id: I71a896623ea9e1f042a73dc0678ce85acf0dc87d

commit_message:
Rename `resource`_data/url attributes to manifest/manifest_url

Pod, Service and ReplicationController have data and definition_url attribute,
but it's name is needlessly long.
This fixes it to more appropriate attribute name.

Change-Id: I64e8922ef8f6fc0dc4a7fda02aa0913ca15177e4

commit_message:
Fix _retrive_k8s_master_url

If baymodel.apiserver_port is None, _retrive_k8s_master_url method return
invalid k8s master address. This fixes it.

Change-Id: Ieb907fbdb8a81b6b7a69f4d13549a24c3b58e6f8
Closes-Bug: #1411518

commit_message:
Add support for manage/unmanage volume commands to PureISCSIDriver

This change adds implementations of the required methods to make
manage and unmanage commands work with the PureISCSIDriver. You can now
call them and specify a volume name of an existing non-cinder volume on
the array and it will rename the volume accordingly to allow cinder to
manage it. When a volume is unmanaged it is renamed with a “-unmanaged”
suffix and left on the array.

Implements: blueprint pure-iscsi-manage-volume
Change-Id: I2fa63ba50a367fd06a2ede7768eb338bf6a1ee4e

added_lines: def test_manage_existing(self): ref_name = 'vol1' volume_ref = {'name': ref_name} self.array.list_volume_hosts.return_value = [] vol_name = VOLUME['name'] + '-cinder' self.driver.manage_existing(VOLUME, volume_ref) self.array.list_volume_hosts.assert_called_with(ref_name) self.array.rename_volume.assert_called_with(ref_name, vol_name) def test_manage_existing_error_propagates(self): self.assert_error_propagates([self.array.list_volume_hosts, self.array.rename_volume], self.driver.manage_existing, VOLUME, {'name': 'vol1'}) def test_manage_existing_bad_ref(self): self.assertRaises(exception.ManageExistingInvalidReference, self.driver.manage_existing, VOLUME, {'bad_key': 'bad_value'}) self.assertRaises(exception.ManageExistingInvalidReference, self.driver.manage_existing, VOLUME, {'name': ''}) self.assertRaises(exception.ManageExistingInvalidReference, self.driver.manage_existing, VOLUME, {'name': None}) self.array.volume_info.side_effect = \ exception.PureAPIException(message="Volume does not exist.", code=400) self.assertRaises(exception.ManageExistingInvalidReference, self.driver.manage_existing, VOLUME, {'name': 'non-existing-volume'}) def test_manage_existing_with_connected_hosts(self): ref_name = 'vol1' self.array.list_volume_hosts.return_value = ["host1", "host2"] self.assertRaises(exception.ManageExistingInvalidReference, self.driver.manage_existing, VOLUME, {'name': ref_name}) self.array.list_volume_hosts.assert_called_with(ref_name) self.assertFalse(self.array.rename_volume.called) def test_manage_existing_get_size(self): ref_name = 'vol1' volume_ref = {'name': ref_name} expected_size = 5 self.array.volume_info.return_value = {"size": 5368709120} size = self.driver.manage_existing_get_size(VOLUME, volume_ref) self.assertEqual(expected_size, size) self.array.volume_info.assert_called_with(ref_name) def test_manage_existing_get_size_error_propagates(self): self.assert_error_propagates([self.array.volume_info], self.driver.manage_existing_get_size, VOLUME, {'name': 'vol1'}) def test_manage_existing_get_size_bad_ref(self): self.assertRaises(exception.ManageExistingInvalidReference, self.driver.manage_existing_get_size, VOLUME, {'bad_key': 'bad_value'}) self.assertRaises(exception.ManageExistingInvalidReference, self.driver.manage_existing_get_size, VOLUME, {'name': ''}) self.assertRaises(exception.ManageExistingInvalidReference, self.driver.manage_existing_get_size, VOLUME, {'name': None}) def test_unmanage(self): vol_name = VOLUME['name'] + "-cinder" unmanaged_vol_name = vol_name + "-unmanaged" self.driver.unmanage(VOLUME) self.array.rename_volume.assert_called_with(vol_name, unmanaged_vol_name) def test_unmanage_error_propagates(self): self.assert_error_propagates([self.array.rename_volume], self.driver.unmanage, VOLUME) def test_unmange_with_deleted_volume(self): vol_name = VOLUME['name'] + "-cinder" unmanaged_vol_name = vol_name + "-unmanaged" self.array.rename_volume.side_effect = \ exception.PureAPIException(message="Volume does not exist.", code=400) self.driver.unmanage(VOLUME) self.array.rename_volume.assert_called_with(vol_name, unmanaged_vol_name) def test_rename_volume(self, mock_req): mock_req.return_value = self.result result = self.array.rename_volume("vol-name", "new-vol-name") self.assertEqual(self.result, result) mock_req.assert_called_with(self.array, "PUT", "volume/vol-name", {"name": "new-vol-name"}) self.assert_error_propagates([mock_req], self.array.rename_volume, "vol-name", "new-vol-name") def test_volume_info(self, mock_req): mock_req.return_value = self.result result = self.array.volume_info("vol-name") self.assertEqual(self.result, result) mock_req.assert_called_with(self.array, "GET", "volume/vol-name") self.assert_error_propagates([mock_req], self.array.volume_info, "vol-name")

Fix incorrect attribute name in matchmaker_redis

self.register and fix the AttributeError.

commit_message:
Add to rally non voting unstable performance job

Add to rally check unstalbe non voting job. This job will be used
for tracking status of unstable functionality of OpenStack.

Next functionality works bad:

1) Attaching disks
VMTask.boot_run_command with disk
https://github.com/stackforge/rally/blob/9f18969054c1764dd8b3413f10f21376d19ab431/rally-jobs/rally.yaml#L1017

2) Cinder snapshots
CinderVolumes.create_nested_snapshots_and_attach_volume
https://github.com/stackforge/rally/blob/9f18969054c1764dd8b3413f10f21376d19ab431/rally-jobs/rally-neutron.yaml#L706

3) Security Groups
Especially this one NovaSecGroup.boot_and_delete_server_with_secgroups:
https://github.com/stackforge/rally/blob/9f18969054c1764dd8b3413f10f21376d19ab431/rally-jobs/rally.yaml#L1119-L1141

And others...

We would like to keep them running to at least see that sometimes they work, but
we don't want to block our gates.

Change-Id: I1a2353052ca6727f1cdc8a5da85e3230db883177

commit_message:
Scality: Lock around SOFS mount to avoid a race

Both cinder-volume and cinder-backup could want to mount the
SOFS at the same time (during init).

Related-Bug: #1410341
Change-Id: I75faa6eb283bc7c1f655cf5b051bed025af3d701

Disable unbalanced-tuple-unpacking

This check seems to have changed and started to break in Neutron.
Disabling it is one way we could get back to good.

commit_message:
Move oslo.db to oslo_db namespace

This is the second in a series of changes to move to using
the new oslo_<library> namespace that is being used for
oslo libraries.

There is currently a shim in place that is allowing the old
oslo.<library> imports to work, but we need to be prepared for
when the shims go away.  Thus, we need patches like this one to
move to the new namespace.

This patch also updates our hacking check to ensure that no instances
of oslo.db sneak back in.

Change-Id: Ibebed114a362e199e03c83d7d229841e8f88932b

commit_message:
Switch the PureISCSIDriver over to using the purestorage pypi module.

All management api's will now go through the purestorage module, the
interface is extremely similar to the original FlashArray object
included in the cinder.volume.drivers.pure module. This allows for
updates to the REST API and python code that uses it to not disrupt the
cinder driver.

Implements: blueprint pure-iscsi-purestorage-lib
Change-Id: Ifcfb1c2337e5837f2121929c4788137d8bd1cf42

commit_message:
Fix zfssa driver volume attach to work with latest zfssa software

This fixes the volume attach issue of the zfssa driver
with the latest zfssa software release and makes it work
for all zfssa versions.

Change-Id: I4b9ceb7788c112ee5998f24b00a07d4346bc6275
Closes-Bug: #1411291

subject: Fix eqlx endless loop when server closes the connection
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-01-14 06:07:17.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/cinder/commit/2954baf898635c2c82a33e8f6af21495df3206e0', 'message': 'Fix eqlx endless loop when server closes the connection

The eqlx driver would identify one CLI command completion by looking for the
system name prompt in the output ("ARRAY_NAME>"). But some cases where there
is no "ARRAY_NAME>" in the output. The eqlx server closes the ssh connection
immediately after sends such message, which lead to a infinite loop in
_get_output() and 100% CPU utilization.

What the patch does is to check the return of chan.recv(), if the length of
returned string is zero, which means server has closed the connection, the
loop will be exited.

commit_message:
Fix eqlx endless loop when server closes the connection

The eqlx driver would identify one CLI command completion by looking
for the system name prompt in the output ("ARRAY_NAME>"). But some
cases where there is no "ARRAY_NAME>" in the output. The eqlx server
closes the ssh connection immediately after sends such message, which
lead to a infinite loop in _get_output() and 100% CPU utilization.

What the patch does is to check the return of chan.recv(), if the
length of returned string is zero, which means server has closed the
connection, the loop will be exited.

Closes-Bug: #1410627

Signed-off-by: Dunrong Huang <riegamaths@gmail.com>
Change-Id: I600c38d98f0f808c98df010a89ac58ca8e43f1a3
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/cinder refs/changes/70/147070/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: ret = chan.recv(102400) if len(ret) == 0: # According to paramiko.channel.Channl documentation, which # says "If a string of length zero is returned, the channel # stream has closed". So we can confirm that the EQL server # has close the connection. msg = _("EQLX server closes the connection") LOG.error(msg) raise processutils.ProcessExecutionError(description=msg) out += ret

commit_message:
Increase unit test coverage in hacking test

Added a few unit tests to increase the test coverage from
~60% up to 90%.  Also modified the assertEqual of all tests
to be in the form of assertEqual(EXPECTED, ACTUAL) format.

Change-Id: If53cfae138c3e31d21e34aa86048d02a19fb6346

commit_message:
Remove unused scheduler driver methods

Commits 8466013fbed8b0ec7bb64c6eb183c9bb1b846665 and
cd16fa7b485e53f611a3f831569ddacce5393368 remove the last uses of
instance_update_db() and handle_schedule_error().

Change-Id: Ia1f1075f52516c0cdff4b0d1fc5f0a8738d0ee1d

subject: Fixed server name being retained after detach in LeftHand
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-09-25 19:30:12.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/cinder/commit/cec6756615a4c2f01495e7612a503b2d81acbbdd', 'message': 'Fixed server name being retained after detach in LeftHand

There was an issue with the LeftHand driver where the
initiator names of servers were not being removed when the last
volume attached to that server was detached.

This fix will now remove the server from the LeftHand backend
when no more volumes are attached to it.

commit_message:
Fixed server name being retained after detach in LeftHand

There was an issue with the LeftHand driver where the
initiator names of servers were not being removed when the last
volume attached to that server was detached.

This fix will now remove the server from the LeftHand backend
when no more volumes are attached to it.

Closes-Bug: #1353137
Change-Id: I58be39d14979e1d3966232095cb49693c1424f8a
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/cinder refs/changes/45/124145/7 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Use assertRaisesRegexp() in test_srb.py.

Python >= 2.7 should be using assertRaisesRegexp()
rather than assertRaisesRegex().

Change-Id: I033b88d50cf90503e1123a9871c1bc252d914c06
Closes-Bug: 1407781

added_lines: try: self.assertRaisesRegex(processutils.ProcessExecutionError, r'^Oops', f) except: self.assertRaisesRegexp(processutils.ProcessExecutionError, r'^Oops', f) try: self.assertRaisesRegex(RuntimeError, r'^Oops', f) except: self.assertRaisesRegexp(RuntimeError, r'^Oops', f)

commit_message:
Remove cloud-init-datasources element from ubuntu dependencies.

Adding cloud-init-datasources dependency in Ubuntu element
is causing trouble to boot instances that don't need
cloud-init functionality.
Should be better to remove it from Ubuntu dependency and
add it only to deployments needed.

As a consequence, moved 99-cloud-init-datasources.bash script
to cloud-init-datasources element, so it's the element it
belongs to.

Change-Id: Ia0be93a1f58708030066be2944e4775ea3a827e6

commit_message:
Fixes misspelled words in Cinder

Fixes misspelled words found by 'misspellings' in one shot

* pip install misspellings
* git ls-files | grep -v locale | misspellings -f -

commit_message:
Do not use job 'gate-manila-tempest-dsvm-neutron' with manilaclient

Tempest job 'gate-manila-tempest-dsvm-neutron' for manilaclient was performing
CLI functional tests. We do not need this anymore since we have same tests
implemented within functional tests of manilaclient itself, that are run using
job 'check-manilaclient-dsvm-neutron-functional'.
See: b2e554d2d460b3ac52cbfa9a9d65093d845c76d3

Change-Id: I20ebfa629e872b54466c38b3030ae429aaffa756

commit_message:
Poll resource tracker for ironic cpus as well as count

When ironic nodes are enrolled, their resources are not available
to the nova scheduler until after a round of ironic and nova periodic
tasks have run  In addition to waiting for ironic nodes to show up in
the resource tracker, also wait for associated CPU resources.  In
the worst case, this means waiting for 3 total rounds of periodic
tasks.

Closes-bug: #1398128
(cherry picked from commit 0c99e2f65b6e86236c0d29928c110628f1e32f3d)

Conflicts:
	lib/ironic

Change-Id: Idbbc43bf74ff5fff3d50f3494148454bb51e378f
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/devstack refs/changes/97/141697/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # After nodes have been enrolled, we need to wait for both ironic and # nova's periodic tasks to populate the resource tracker with available # nodes and resources. Wait up to 2 minutes for a given resource before # timing out. local resource=$1 local expected_count=$2 echo_summary "Waiting 2 minutes for Nova resource tracker to pick up $resource >= $expected_count" if [ $(nova hypervisor-stats | grep " $resource " | get_field 2) -ge $expected_count ]; then die $LINENO "Timed out waiting for Nova hypervisor-stats $resource >= $expected_count" local total_cpus=0 total_cpus=$((total_cpus+$ironic_node_cpu)) wait_for_nova_resources "count" $total_nodes wait_for_nova_resources "vcpus" $total_cpus
deleted_lines: # After nodes have been enrolled, we need to wait for n-cpu's periodic # task populate the resource tracker with available nodes. Wait for 2 # minutes before timing out. local expected_count=$1 echo_summary "Waiting 2 minutes for Nova resource tracker to pick up $expected_count Ironic nodes" if [ $(nova hypervisor-stats | grep " count " | get_field 2) -ge $expected_count ]; then die $LINENO "Nova hypervisor-stats did not register at least $expected_count nodes" wait_for_nova_resources $total_nodes

commit_message:
Migrate rest_client to tempest-lib from tempest

This patch migrates rest_client module to tempest-lib from tempest.

The latest Change-Ids of each file are the following when this migration:
 * common/http.py             : I43703e2289212389c7841f44691ae7849ed1f505
 * common/rest_client.py      : Ie9105b5d01e7883213c1d3398cc5fe56782920d9
 * common/utils/misc.py       : I9a591eaa1cf4dabba58f06a64814611a05a51365
 * exceptions.py              : Ic8fc216377942619f11a2462b79d0597071ac294
 * tests/base.py              : I8f14cd2ca6afc38d3fe8ee758272071111022896
 * tests/fake_auth_provider.py: Id12341de52204e2c428e10b4b758b700b0fbab09
 * tests/fake_http.py         : I8f14cd2ca6afc38d3fe8ee758272071111022896
 * tests/test_rest_client.py  : Ie9105b5d01e7883213c1d3398cc5fe56782920d9

NOTE: Some docstrings are changed to avoid H404 and H405.

Change-Id: I879a02681c99376ae57458a0f7a04c8032dfebb2

git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/security-doc refs/changes/41/148041/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: "POT-Creation-Date: 2015-01-16 10:04+0000\n" "PO-Revision-Date: 2015-01-16 10:04+0000\n"#: ./security-guide/section_tls-proxies-and-http-services.xml39(para)#: ./security-guide/section_tls-proxies-and-http-services.xml8(title) msgid "TLS proxies and HTTP services" msgstr "" #: ./security-guide/section_tls-proxies-and-http-services.xml9(para) msgid "" "OpenStack endpoints are HTTP services providing APIs to both end-users on " "public networks and to other OpenStack services on the management network. " "It is highly recommended that all of these requests, both internal and " "external, operate over TLS. To achieve this goal, API services must be " "deployed behind a TLS proxy that can establish and terminate TLS sessions. " "The following table offers a non-exhaustive list of open source software " "that can be used for this purpose:" msgstr "" #: ./security-guide/section_tls-proxies-and-http-services.xml16(link) #: ./security-guide/section_tls-proxies-and-http-services.xml110(title) msgid "Pound" msgstr "Pound" #: ./security-guide/section_tls-proxies-and-http-services.xml19(link) #: ./security-guide/section_tls-proxies-and-http-services.xml164(title) msgid "Stud" msgstr "Stud" #: ./security-guide/section_tls-proxies-and-http-services.xml22(link) #: ./security-guide/section_tls-proxies-and-http-services.xml203(title) msgid "nginx" msgstr "nginx" #: ./security-guide/section_tls-proxies-and-http-services.xml25(link) msgid "Apache httpd" msgstr "Apache httpd" #: ./security-guide/section_tls-proxies-and-http-services.xml28(para) msgid "" "In cases where software termination offers insufficient performance, " "hardware accelerators may be worth exploring as an alternative option. It is" " important to be mindful of the size of requests that will be processed by " "any chosen TLS proxy." msgstr "" #: ./security-guide/section_tls-proxies-and-http-services.xml32(title) msgid "Examples" msgstr "例" #: ./security-guide/section_tls-proxies-and-http-services.xml33(para) msgid "" "Below we provide sample recommended configuration settings for enabling TLS " "in some of the more popular web servers/TLS terminators." msgstr "" #: ./security-guide/section_tls-proxies-and-http-services.xml35(para) msgid "" "Before we delve into the configurations, we briefly discuss the ciphers' " "configuration element and its format. A more exhaustive treatment on " "available ciphers and the OpenSSL cipher list format can be found at: <link " "href=\"https://www.openssl.org/docs/apps/ciphers.html\">ciphers</link>." msgstr "設定を掘り下げる前に、暗号の設定要素とその形式について簡単に議論します。利用可能な暗号におけるより包括的な使い方、および OpenSSL 暗号一覧形式が <link href=\"https://www.openssl.org/docs/apps/ciphers.html\">ciphers</link> にあります。" #: ./security-guide/section_tls-proxies-and-http-services.xml43(para) msgid "" "Cipher string options are separated by \":\", while \"!\" provides negation " "of the immediately following element. Element order indicates preference " "unless overridden by qualifiers such as HIGH. Let us take a closer look at " "the elements in the above sample strings." msgstr "暗号オプションの文字列は「:」で区切られます。「!」は直後の要素の否定を意味します。要素の順番は、HIGH のような修飾語句により上書きされない限り、優先度を意味します。上のサンプル文字列の要素をもう少し具体的に見ていきましょう。" #: ./security-guide/section_tls-proxies-and-http-services.xml46(code) msgid "kEECDH:kEDH" msgstr "kEECDH:kEDH" #: ./security-guide/section_tls-proxies-and-http-services.xml48(para) msgid "" "Ephemeral Elliptic Curve Diffie-Hellman (abbreviated as EECDH and ECDHE)." msgstr "楕円曲線ディフィー・ヘルマン (EECDH や ECDHE と略す)" #: ./security-guide/section_tls-proxies-and-http-services.xml49(para) msgid "" "Ephemeral Diffie-Hellman (abbreviated either as EDH or DHE) uses prime field" " groups." msgstr "一時ディフィー・ヘルマン (EDH や DHE と略す) は素体グループを使用します。" #: ./security-guide/section_tls-proxies-and-http-services.xml50(para) msgid "" "Both approaches provide <link " "href=\"http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Forward_secrecy\">Perfect Forward " "Secrecy (PFS)</link>." msgstr "どちらの方法も <link href=\"http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Forward_secrecy\">Perfect Forward Secrecy (PFS)</link> を提供します。" #: ./security-guide/section_tls-proxies-and-http-services.xml51(para) msgid "" "Ephemeral Elliptic Curves require the server to be configured with a named " "curve, and provide better security than prime field groups and at lower " "computational cost. However, prime field groups are more widely implemented," " and thus typically both are included in list." msgstr "一時楕円曲線はサーバーが名前付き曲線を用いて設定されている必要があります。素体グループよりセキュリティが高く、計算コストが低いです。しかしながら、素体グループはより幅広く実装されているので、一般的にどちらも一覧に含まれます。" #: ./security-guide/section_tls-proxies-and-http-services.xml55(code) msgid "kRSA" msgstr "kRSA" #: ./security-guide/section_tls-proxies-and-http-services.xml57(para) msgid "" "Cipher suites using the <link " "href=\"http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/RSA_%28cryptosystem%29\">RSA</link> " "exchange, authentication or either respectively." msgstr "<link href=\"http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/RSA_%28cryptosystem%29\">RSA</link> の鍵交換、認証、またはその両方を使用する暗号スイート。" #: ./security-guide/section_tls-proxies-and-http-services.xml61(code) msgid "HIGH" msgstr "HIGH" #: ./security-guide/section_tls-proxies-and-http-services.xml63(para) msgid "" "Selects highest possible security cipher in the negotiation phase. These " "typically have keys of length 128 bits or longer." msgstr "ネゴシエーション段階で利用可能な最高のセキュリティ暗号を選択します。これらは一般的に 128 ビット以上の鍵を持ちます。" #: ./security-guide/section_tls-proxies-and-http-services.xml67(code) msgid "!RC4" msgstr "!RC4" #: ./security-guide/section_tls-proxies-and-http-services.xml69(para) msgid "" "No RC4. RC4 has flaws in the context of TLS/SSL V3. See <link " "href=\"http://cr.yp.to/streamciphers/rc4biases-20130708.pdf\"> On the " "Security of RC4 in TLS and WPA</link>." msgstr "" #: ./security-guide/section_tls-proxies-and-http-services.xml73(code) msgid "!MD5" msgstr "!MD5" #: ./security-guide/section_tls-proxies-and-http-services.xml75(para) msgid "" "No MD5. MD5 is not collision resistant, and thus not acceptable for Message " "Authentication Codes (MAC) or signatures." msgstr "MD5 使用不可。MD5 は衝突耐性がないため、メッセージ認証コード (MAC) や署名に利用できません。" #: ./security-guide/section_tls-proxies-and-http-services.xml79(code) msgid "!aNULL:!eNULL" msgstr "!aNULL:!eNULL" #: ./security-guide/section_tls-proxies-and-http-services.xml81(para) msgid "Disallows clear text." msgstr "" #: ./security-guide/section_tls-proxies-and-http-services.xml85(code) msgid "!EXP" msgstr "!EXP" #: ./security-guide/section_tls-proxies-and-http-services.xml87(para) msgid "" "Disallows export encryption algorithms, which by design tend to be weak, " "typically using 40 and 56 bit keys." msgstr "" #: ./security-guide/section_tls-proxies-and-http-services.xml89(para) msgid "" "US Export restrictions on cryptography systems have been lifted and no " "longer need to be supported." msgstr "暗号システムにおけるアメリカ輸出規制を解かれていて、もはやサポートする必要がありません。" #: ./security-guide/section_tls-proxies-and-http-services.xml93(code) msgid "!LOW:!MEDIUM" msgstr "!LOW:!MEDIUM" #: ./security-guide/section_tls-proxies-and-http-services.xml95(para) msgid "" "Disallows low (56 or 64 bit long keys) and medium (128 bit long keys) " "ciphers because of their vulnerability to brute force attacks (example " "2-DES). This rule still permits Triple Data Encryption Standard (Triple DES)" " also known as Triple Data Encryption Algorithm (TDEA) and the Advanced " "Encryption Standard (AES), each of which has keys greater than equal to 128 " "bits and thus more secure." msgstr "" #: ./security-guide/section_tls-proxies-and-http-services.xml103(code) msgid "Protocols" msgstr "プロトコル" #: ./security-guide/section_tls-proxies-and-http-services.xml105(para) msgid "" "Protocols are enabled/disabled through SSL_CTX_set_options. We recommend " "disabling SSLv2/v3 and enabling TLS." msgstr "" #: ./security-guide/section_tls-proxies-and-http-services.xml111(para) msgid "" "This Pound example enables <literal>AES-NI</literal> acceleration, which " "helps to improve performance on systems with processors that support this " "feature." msgstr "" #: ./security-guide/section_tls-proxies-and-http-services.xml165(para) msgid "" "The <emphasis role=\"italic\">ciphers</emphasis> line can be tweaked based " "on your needs, however this is a reasonable starting place." msgstr "" #: ./security-guide/section_tls-proxies-and-http-services.xml204(para) msgid "" "This nginx example requires TLS v1.1 or v1.2 for maximum security. The " "<placeholder-1/> line can be tweaked based on your needs, however this is a " "reasonable starting place." msgstr "" #: ./security-guide/section_tls-proxies-and-http-services.xml222(title) msgid "Apache" msgstr "Apache" #: ./security-guide/section_tls-proxies-and-http-services.xml247(para) msgid "" "Compute API SSL endpoint in Apache, which you must pair with a short WSGI " "script." msgstr "Apache 中の Compute API SSL エンドポイント (短い WSGI スクリプトと組み合わせる必要あり)" #: ./security-guide/section_tls-proxies-and-http-services.xml271(title) msgid "HTTP strict transport security" msgstr "HTTP Strict Transport Security" #: ./security-guide/section_tls-proxies-and-http-services.xml272(para) msgid "" "We recommend that all production deployments use HTTP strict transport " "security (HSTS). This header prevents browsers from making insecure " "connections after they have made a single secure one. If you have deployed " "your HTTP services on a public or an untrusted domain, HSTS is especially " "important. To enable HSTS, configure your web server to send a header like " "this with all requests:" msgstr "" #: ./security-guide/section_tls-proxies-and-http-services.xml278(para) msgid "" "Start with a short timeout of 1 day during testing, and raise it to one year" " after testing has shown that you have not introduced problems for users. " "Note that once this header is set to a large timeout, it is (by design) very" " difficult to disable." msgstr ""
deleted_lines: "POT-Creation-Date: 2015-01-06 16:06+0000\n" "PO-Revision-Date: 2015-01-06 16:06+0000\n"#: ./security-guide/section_ssl-proxies-and-http-services.xml40(para)#: ./security-guide/section_ssl-proxies-and-http-services.xml8(title) msgid "SSL proxies and HTTP services" msgstr "SSLプロキシとHTTPサービス" #: ./security-guide/section_ssl-proxies-and-http-services.xml9(para) msgid "" "OpenStack endpoints are HTTP services providing APIs to both end-users on " "public networks and to other OpenStack services on the management network. " "It is highly recommended that all of these requests, both internal and " "external, operate over SSL. To achieve this goal, API services must be " "deployed behind a SSL proxy that can establish and terminate SSL sessions. " "The following table offers a non-exhaustive list of open source software " "that can be used for this purpose:" msgstr "" #: ./security-guide/section_ssl-proxies-and-http-services.xml16(link) #: ./security-guide/section_ssl-proxies-and-http-services.xml111(title) msgid "Pound" msgstr "Pound" #: ./security-guide/section_ssl-proxies-and-http-services.xml19(link) #: ./security-guide/section_ssl-proxies-and-http-services.xml165(title) msgid "Stud" msgstr "Stud" #: ./security-guide/section_ssl-proxies-and-http-services.xml22(link) #: ./security-guide/section_ssl-proxies-and-http-services.xml204(title) msgid "nginx" msgstr "nginx" #: ./security-guide/section_ssl-proxies-and-http-services.xml25(link) msgid "Apache httpd" msgstr "Apache httpd" #: ./security-guide/section_ssl-proxies-and-http-services.xml28(para) msgid "" "In cases where software termination offers insufficient performance, " "hardware accelerators may be worth exploring as an alternative option. It is" " important to be mindful of the size of requests that will be processed by " "any chosen SSL proxy." msgstr "" #: ./security-guide/section_ssl-proxies-and-http-services.xml32(title) msgid "Examples" msgstr "例" #: ./security-guide/section_ssl-proxies-and-http-services.xml33(para) msgid "" "Below we provide sample recommended configuration settings for enabling SSL " "in some of the more popular web servers/SSL terminators. Note that we have " "SSL v3 enabled in some of these examples as this will be required in many " "deployments for client compatibility." msgstr "" #: ./security-guide/section_ssl-proxies-and-http-services.xml36(para) msgid "" "Before we delve into the configurations, we briefly discuss the ciphers' " "configuration element and its format. A more exhaustive treatment on " "available ciphers and the OpenSSL cipher list format can be found at: <link " "href=\"https://www.openssl.org/docs/apps/ciphers.html\">ciphers</link>." msgstr "設定を掘り下げる前に、暗号の設定要素とその形式について簡単に議論します。利用可能な暗号におけるより包括的な使い方、および OpenSSL 暗号一覧形式が <link href=\"https://www.openssl.org/docs/apps/ciphers.html\">ciphers</link> にあります。" #: ./security-guide/section_ssl-proxies-and-http-services.xml44(para) msgid "" "Cipher string options are separated by \":\", while \"!\" provides negation " "of the immediately following element. Element order indicates preference " "unless overridden by qualifiers such as HIGH. Let us take a closer look at " "the elements in the above sample strings." msgstr "暗号オプションの文字列は「:」で区切られます。「!」は直後の要素の否定を意味します。要素の順番は、HIGH のような修飾語句により上書きされない限り、優先度を意味します。上のサンプル文字列の要素をもう少し具体的に見ていきましょう。" #: ./security-guide/section_ssl-proxies-and-http-services.xml47(code) msgid "kEECDH:kEDH" msgstr "kEECDH:kEDH" #: ./security-guide/section_ssl-proxies-and-http-services.xml49(para) msgid "" "Ephemeral Elliptic Curve Diffie-Hellman (abbreviated as EECDH and ECDHE)." msgstr "楕円曲線ディフィー・ヘルマン (EECDH や ECDHE と略す)" #: ./security-guide/section_ssl-proxies-and-http-services.xml50(para) msgid "" "Ephemeral Diffie-Hellman (abbreviated either as EDH or DHE) uses prime field" " groups." msgstr "一時ディフィー・ヘルマン (EDH や DHE と略す) は素体グループを使用します。" #: ./security-guide/section_ssl-proxies-and-http-services.xml51(para) msgid "" "Both approaches provide <link " "href=\"http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Forward_secrecy\">Perfect Forward " "Secrecy (PFS)</link>." msgstr "どちらの方法も <link href=\"http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Forward_secrecy\">Perfect Forward Secrecy (PFS)</link> を提供します。" #: ./security-guide/section_ssl-proxies-and-http-services.xml52(para) msgid "" "Ephemeral Elliptic Curves require the server to be configured with a named " "curve, and provide better security than prime field groups and at lower " "computational cost. However, prime field groups are more widely implemented," " and thus typically both are included in list." msgstr "一時楕円曲線はサーバーが名前付き曲線を用いて設定されている必要があります。素体グループよりセキュリティが高く、計算コストが低いです。しかしながら、素体グループはより幅広く実装されているので、一般的にどちらも一覧に含まれます。" #: ./security-guide/section_ssl-proxies-and-http-services.xml56(code) msgid "kRSA" msgstr "kRSA" #: ./security-guide/section_ssl-proxies-and-http-services.xml58(para) msgid "" "Cipher suites using the <link " "href=\"http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/RSA_%28cryptosystem%29\">RSA</link> " "exchange, authentication or either respectively." msgstr "<link href=\"http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/RSA_%28cryptosystem%29\">RSA</link> の鍵交換、認証、またはその両方を使用する暗号スイート。" #: ./security-guide/section_ssl-proxies-and-http-services.xml62(code) msgid "HIGH" msgstr "HIGH" #: ./security-guide/section_ssl-proxies-and-http-services.xml64(para) msgid "" "Selects highest possible security cipher in the negotiation phase. These " "typically have keys of length 128 bits or longer." msgstr "ネゴシエーション段階で利用可能な最高のセキュリティ暗号を選択します。これらは一般的に 128 ビット以上の鍵を持ちます。" #: ./security-guide/section_ssl-proxies-and-http-services.xml68(code) msgid "!RC4" msgstr "!RC4" #: ./security-guide/section_ssl-proxies-and-http-services.xml70(para) msgid "" "No RC4. RC4 has flaws in the context of TLS/SSL V3. See <link " "href=\"http://cr.yp.to/streamciphers/rc4biases-20130708.pdf\"> On the " "Security of RC4 in TLS and WPA</link>." msgstr "" #: ./security-guide/section_ssl-proxies-and-http-services.xml74(code) msgid "!MD5" msgstr "!MD5" #: ./security-guide/section_ssl-proxies-and-http-services.xml76(para) msgid "" "No MD5. MD5 is not collision resistant, and thus not acceptable for Message " "Authentication Codes (MAC) or signatures." msgstr "MD5 使用不可。MD5 は衝突耐性がないため、メッセージ認証コード (MAC) や署名に利用できません。" #: ./security-guide/section_ssl-proxies-and-http-services.xml80(code) msgid "!aNULL:!eNULL" msgstr "!aNULL:!eNULL" #: ./security-guide/section_ssl-proxies-and-http-services.xml82(para) msgid "Disallows clear text." msgstr "" #: ./security-guide/section_ssl-proxies-and-http-services.xml86(code) msgid "!EXP" msgstr "!EXP" #: ./security-guide/section_ssl-proxies-and-http-services.xml88(para) msgid "" "Disallows export encryption algorithms, which by design tend to be weak, " "typically using 40 and 56 bit keys." msgstr "" #: ./security-guide/section_ssl-proxies-and-http-services.xml90(para) msgid "" "US Export restrictions on cryptography systems have been lifted and no " "longer need to be supported." msgstr "暗号システムにおけるアメリカ輸出規制を解かれていて、もはやサポートする必要がありません。" #: ./security-guide/section_ssl-proxies-and-http-services.xml94(code) msgid "!LOW:!MEDIUM" msgstr "!LOW:!MEDIUM" #: ./security-guide/section_ssl-proxies-and-http-services.xml96(para) msgid "" "Disallows low (56 or 64 bit long keys) and medium (128 bit long keys) " "ciphers because of their vulnerability to brute force attacks (example " "2-DES). This rule still permits Triple Data Encryption Standard (Triple DES)" " also known as Triple Data Encryption Algorithm (TDEA) and the Advanced " "Encryption Standard (AES), each of which has keys greater than equal to 128 " "bits and thus more secure." msgstr "" #: ./security-guide/section_ssl-proxies-and-http-services.xml104(code) msgid "Protocols" msgstr "プロトコル" #: ./security-guide/section_ssl-proxies-and-http-services.xml106(para) msgid "" "Protocols are enabled/disabled through SSL_CTX_set_options. We recommend " "disabling SSLv2 and enabling TLS or SSLv3 (which was standardized as TLS " "with a few changes)." msgstr "" #: ./security-guide/section_ssl-proxies-and-http-services.xml112(para) msgid "" "This Pound example enables <literal>AES-NI</literal> acceleration, which " "helps to improve performance on systems with processors that support this " "feature." msgstr "" #: ./security-guide/section_ssl-proxies-and-http-services.xml166(para) msgid "" "This stud example enables SSL v3 for client compatibility. The <emphasis " "role=\"italic\">ciphers</emphasis> line can be tweaked based on your needs, " "however this is a reasonable starting place." msgstr "" #: ./security-guide/section_ssl-proxies-and-http-services.xml205(para) msgid "" "This nginx example requires TLS v1.1 or v1.2 for maximum security. The " "<placeholder-1/> line can be tweaked based on your needs, however this is a " "reasonable starting place." msgstr "" #: ./security-guide/section_ssl-proxies-and-http-services.xml223(title) msgid "Apache" msgstr "Apache" #: ./security-guide/section_ssl-proxies-and-http-services.xml248(para) msgid "" "Compute API SSL endpoint in Apache, which you must pair with a short WSGI " "script." msgstr "Apache 中の Compute API SSL エンドポイント (短い WSGI スクリプトと組み合わせる必要あり)" #: ./security-guide/section_ssl-proxies-and-http-services.xml272(title) msgid "HTTP strict transport security" msgstr "HTTP Strict Transport Security" #: ./security-guide/section_ssl-proxies-and-http-services.xml273(para) msgid "" "We recommend that all production deployments use HTTP strict transport " "security (HSTS). This header prevents browsers from making insecure " "connections after they have made a single secure one. If you have deployed " "your HTTP services on a public or an untrusted domain, HSTS is especially " "important. To enable HSTS, configure your web server to send a header like " "this with all requests:" msgstr "" #: ./security-guide/section_ssl-proxies-and-http-services.xml279(para) msgid "" "Start with a short timeout of 1 day during testing, and raise it to one year" " after testing has shown that you have not introduced problems for users. " "Note that once this header is set to a large timeout, it is (by design) very" " difficult to disable." msgstr ""

For more information about this automatic import see:
https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/Translations/Infrastructure

git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/api-site refs/changes/54/147754/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # fhqidx , 2014 # Hunt Xu , 2015 # Ying Chun Guo , 2012,2014"POT-Creation-Date: 2015-01-14 07:10+0000 " "PO-Revision-Date: 2015-01-16 02:50+0000 " "Last-Translator: Hunt Xu "msgstr "OpenStack 命令行客户端"msgstr "如果使用脚本操作，可以使用比如 python-novaclient 之类的命令行客户端。这个客户端能够让您通过命令行接口来使用计算 API。"msgstr "参考 OpenStack 命令行接口参考以了解更多关于命令行客户端的信息。"msgstr "使用 在 Mac OS X 或者 Linux 系统上安装 OpenStack 客户端。这比较方便，并且保证了您能够从 Python Package Index 得到最新的版本。 另外，借助 可以实现更新或者移除 OpenStack 安装包。"msgstr "您必须独立安装每个客户端。"msgstr "运行如下命令安装或更新客户端软件包："msgstr "例如，可以运行如下命令安装 的客户端："msgstr "运行如下命令更新 的客户端："msgstr "运行如下命令移除 的客户端："msgstr "在执行客户端命令之前，您必须先下载并 source openrc 这个文件以设置环境变量。"msgstr "关于 OpenStack 客户端的完整信息，包括如何 source openrc 文件，请参考 OpenStack 最终用户指南，OpenStack 管理员用户指南以及 OpenStack 命令行接口参考。"msgstr "启动虚拟机实例前，需要为其选择名称，镜像和云主机类型。"msgstr "通过 客户端调用相关的计算服务 API 以列出所有可用的镜像，如下所示："msgstr "运行如下命令以列出云主机类型："msgstr "启动虚拟机实例前，记录下您所需的镜像和云主机类型的 ID。"msgstr "使用之前记录下来的镜像和云主机类型的 ID 以及虚拟机名称运行 命令，启动一个名为 my_instance 的虚拟机，如下所示："msgstr "使用 查看虚拟机："msgstr "使用 命令，可以查看指定虚拟机的具体信息。包括虚拟机的 ID："msgstr "关于 OpenStack 各组件使用的默认端口的信息，请参考 OpenStack 配置参考中的附录 A. 防火墙及默认端口。"msgstr "虽然您是独立地安装各个 OpenStack 服务，这些 OpenStack 服务却需要一起工作以满足您的云需求：认证、计算、镜像服务、块存储，联网(neutron)、对象存储，编排以及监控等。在 TryStack 部署的环境中，这些服务在后台很好地协同工作。"msgstr "通过 OpenStack 认证服务的认证后，您可以使用其它的 OpenStack API 来创建和管理您的 OpenStack 云中的资源。您可以从镜像启动虚拟机实例，并通过计算服务 API 或者 命令行客户端来给实例分配元数据。"msgstr "使用如下的方法之一以发送 API 请求："msgstr "一个能够让我们发送 HTTP 请求并接收响应的命令行工具。请参考 。"msgstr "每个 OpenStack 项目都提供了一个让您通过简单的命令访问其 API 的命令行客户端。请参考 。"msgstr "REST 客户端"msgstr "Mozilla 和 Google 都为 REST 提供了基于浏览器的图形界面。对于 Firefox，请参见 RESTClient。对于Chrome，则请参考 rest-client。"msgstr "使用这个 SDK 编写能够在您的 OpenStack 云中创建和管理资源的 Python 自动化脚本。SDK 为 OpenStack API 实现了 Python 语言绑定，这让用户在 Python 中能够通过调用 Python 对象来实现自动化任务，而不用直接调用 REST。所有的 OpenStack 命令行工具都已经在 Python SDK 中得到了实现。请参考 OpenStack 最终用户指南中的 OpenStack Python SDK。"msgstr "OpenStack API"msgstr "要认证对 OpenStack 服务的访问，您首先需要向 OpenStack 认证服务发出认证请求以获得认证令牌。您必须提供有效的证书才能够请求认证令牌。"msgstr "证书通常是您的用户名和密码的组合，或者是您的云环境中的租户的名称或者 ID。联系您的云管理员得到您的用户名、密码以及租户等信息以便于生成认证令牌。作为另外一种选择，您可以提供令牌而不是每次都要提供用户名和密码。"msgstr "发送 API 请求时，您需要将令牌信息置于 HTTP 的 X-Auth-Token 头。当需要访问多个服务时，您需要为每个服务获取一个令牌。令牌只在一个有限的时间内是有效的，超时即无效。令牌也可能因为其他原因而变得无效。例如，如果用户的角色发生了变化，该用户当前存在的令牌也会变得无效。"msgstr "认证与 API 请求工作流"msgstr "从云管理员提供的认证服务接入点请求一个认证令牌。在发送的请求中包含一个有效的证书："msgstr "username (必需)"msgstr "用户名。如果您不提供用户名和密码，那么必须提供令牌。"msgstr "password (必需)"msgstr "该用户的密码。"msgstr "tenantName (可选)"msgstr "租户 Id"msgstr "租户名称。 和 都是可选的，但不能被同时使用。如果这两个属性值都被指定了，服务将会返回 。"msgstr "tenantId (可选)"msgstr "capi:UUID"msgstr "租户的 ID。 和 都是可选的，但不能被同时使用。如果这两个属性值都被指定了，服务将会返回 。如果您不知道 tenantId，您可以发送一个以 "" 作为 tenantId 的请求并在返回中得到该 ID。"msgstr "token (可选)"msgstr "令牌。假如您不提供令牌，则必须提供用户名和密码。"msgstr "在请求成功的情况下，服务器将会返回一个认证令牌。"msgstr "将令牌置于 HTTP 的 X-Auth-Token 头部发送 API 请求。继续使用该令牌发送 API 请求直到工作完成或者 服务器返回 401Unauthorized。"msgstr "当 401Unauthorized 错误出现时，请申请一个新的令牌。"msgstr "本节的示例都是使用 cURL 命令来完成的。关于 cURL 的相关信息，请参考 http://curl.haxx.se/。关于 OpenStack API 的相关信息，则请参考 OpenStack API 参考。"msgstr "在一个运行着认证服务的典型 OpenStack 环境中，使用如下的 cURL 命令来获取令牌："msgstr "当请求成功时，你将会得到 200 OK 的 HTTP 状态码，以及后续一个包含着令牌及其超时时间的响应体。令牌的形式如 "id":"令牌"，超时时间的形式如 "expires":"日期及时间"。"msgstr "下面的例子展示了一个成功的响应："msgstr "假如您不知道您的租户名称或者 ID，您可以使用空 tenantName 发送认证请求，如下所示："msgstr "发送 API 请求"msgstr "本节展示了如何调用基本的计算服务 API。关于完整的计算服务 API 列表，请参考计算服务 API 和扩展。"msgstr "使用计算服务 API 列出云主机类型，如下所示："msgstr "令牌"msgstr "租户 id"msgstr "使用计算服务的 API 列出镜像，如下所示："msgstr "使用计算服务 API 列出虚拟机，如下所示："msgstr "Andi Chandler , 2013Ying Chun Guo , 2012, 2014fhqidx , 2014Hunt Xu , 2015"
deleted_lines: # Ying Chun Guo , 2014"POT-Creation-Date: 2015-01-13 14:24+0000 " "PO-Revision-Date: 2015-01-13 14:24+0000 " "Last-Translator: openstackjenkins "msgstr "OpenStack命令行客户端"msgstr "如果使用脚本操作，可以使用命令行客户端python-novaclient。借助python-novaclient，可以通过命令行接口来使用计算API。"msgstr "如果想要得到命令行客户端的相关信息，可以参考OpenStack Command-Line Interface Reference."msgstr "可以使用 在Mac OS X或者Linux系统上安装OpenStack客户端。我们可以通过Python Package Index来得到最新的客户端版本。 另外，借助可以实现更新或者移除OpenStack安装包。"msgstr "必须独立安装每个客户端。"msgstr "运行如下命令可以安装或更新客户端:"msgstr "例如，安装的客户端，我们可以运行命令:"msgstr "更新 的客户端，可以运行这条命令:"msgstr "移除 的客户端，可以借助这条命令来执行:"msgstr "在发出客户端命令前，我们首先需要执行openrc这个文件使得其中的环境变量生效。"msgstr "如果要得到OpenStack客户端的完整信息，包括如何执行openrc 文件，可以参见OpenStack End User Guide, OpenStack Admin UserGuide, 和 OpenStack Command-Line Interface Reference."msgstr "启动虚拟机实例前，需要选择一个虚拟机名称，指定镜像和云主机类型。"msgstr "通过客户端，可以调用相关的计算服务API列出所有可用的镜像，如下所示:"msgstr "得到可用的云主机类型列表，可以运行如下命令:"msgstr "启动虚拟机实例前，将你需要的镜像和云主机类型标注好。"msgstr "现在启动一个名称为my_instance的虚拟机，运行指定了镜像ID，云主机类型ID和虚拟机名称的 命令来进行操作，如下所示："msgstr "使用命令可以查看虚拟机："msgstr "使用命令，可以查看指定虚拟机的具体信息。包括虚拟机的ID："msgstr "要得到OpenStack各组件使用的默认端口，可以参考Appendix A. 防火墙和其默认端口，参见 in theOpenStack Configuration Reference."msgstr "在安装好OpenStack的各个服务后，OpenStack就可以集成提供如下的服务：认证，计算，镜像服务，块存储服务，网络服务(Neutron)，对象存储服务，模板服务以及云管理平台监控服务等。借助于TryStack 的安装方法，这些服务可以良好地工作在一起。"msgstr "通过OpenStack认证服务的认证后，可以通过其他的OpenStack API来实现创建和管理云资源的功能。可以通过镜像来启动虚拟机实例，也可以通过计算服务API或者命令行客户端来给虚拟机分配元数据。"msgstr "使用API来发送请求，可以使用如下的方法之一："msgstr "借助命令行工具，我们可以发送HTTP请求服务以及接收响应信息。具体参见."msgstr "每个OpenStack工程项目都提供了可以通过命令来访问API的命令行客户端。参见."msgstr "REST客户端"msgstr "Mozilla 和 Google都提供了基于浏览器的REST风格图形接口。对于Firefox，参见RESTClient. 对于Chrome，参见rest-client."msgstr "使用这个SDK编辑Python自动化脚本可以实现创建和管理OpenStack云平台环境资源的功能。SDK实现了Python和OpenStack API之间的绑定，借助它我们就可以通过Python工程中的函数调用来实现自动化的任务，而不再需要直接使用OpenStack提供的REST API调用函数。所有的OpenStack命令行功能都已经在Python SDK中得到了实现。具体可以参见 OpenStack PythonSDK in the OpenStack End User Guide获得详细信息。"msgstr "OpenStack APIs"msgstr "在通过访问OpenStack服务的认证前，首先需要向OpenStack Identity服务发出认证请求以获得认证token。而且必须提供有效的证书，才能得到认证的token。"msgstr "证书通常是由你的用户名和密码组合而成，我们也可以选择把云环境的租户名称或者ID作为证书的一部分来进行验证。通过联系云管理员来得到用户名，密码以及租户信息，借助这些信息可以生成用于认证的令牌。作为另外一种选择，我们就可以通过令牌而不是用户名密码的方式来通过认证。"msgstr "发送API请求OpenStack服务时，需要将token信息置于X-Auth-Token的头部。当需要访问很多服务时，需要为每个服务获取一个token认证值。Token在一个有限的时间内是有效的，除了超时消亡还有一些其他原因也会导致token不可用。例如，如果token的用户发生了变化，现存的token也会变得不可用。"msgstr "认证与API请求工作流"msgstr "根据云管理员提供的认证服务接入点信息，发送一个认证token的请求。在请求中携带一个有效的证书:"msgstr ""msgstr "用户名。如果你不提供一组用户名和密码，那么必须提供token"msgstr ""msgstr "用户的密码"msgstr "租户名称(可选的)"msgstr "租户Id"msgstr "租户名称。 和 都是可选的，但不能被同时具体指定。如果这两个属性值都被指定了，服务将会返回。"msgstr "租户Id(可选的)"msgstr "加密应用程序接口:UUID"msgstr ""msgstr "token(可选的)"msgstr "一个令牌。在不提供token的情况下，你必须提供一组用户名和密码。"msgstr "在请求成功响应的情况下，程序将会返回一个认证令牌。"msgstr "发送API请求，将token信息置于X-Auth-Token的头部。携带token继续发送请求直到该任务完成，或者当未认证401错误出现。"msgstr "当未认证401错误出现时，申请一个新的token用以通过认证。"msgstr "本部分的示例都是使用cURL命令来完成。cURL的相关信息，可以参考http://curl.haxx.se/. OpenStack API的相关信息，可以参考OpenStack API Reference."msgstr "对于一个运行着认证服务的典型OpenStack环境来说，使用如下的cURL命令可以来获取token:"msgstr "当请求成功响应时，你将会得到一个200的HTTP成功状态码以及一个包含着token的响应主体。Token的形式如下: "id":"token"，以及一个token的消亡日期时间"消亡":"时间"。"msgstr "下面的示例是一个成功的响应:"msgstr ""msgstr "发送API请求"msgstr ""msgstr ""msgstr "token"msgstr "租户id"msgstr ""msgstr "使用计算服务API来得到虚拟机列表，如下所示:"msgstr "翻译人员"

commit_message:
MySQL: Ensure MySQL is always started by o-r-c

Previously, in a multi node cluster, o-r-c would never
attempt to start the MySQL server if MySQL had already
been initialized in the past.

Change-Id: Iacccf8b229601e9d073f14699f0f99c2734bbb36
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-image-elements refs/changes/35/142135/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: if ! /etc/init.d/mysql status; then if os-is-bootstrap-host && grep -Eq "^wsrep_cluster_address=gcomm://$LOCAL_IP,?\$" /etc/mysql/conf.d/cluster.cnf; then # For single node setups we can re-bootstrap if were not currently running # We need to ensure we are bootstrap host to prevent our regex succeeding # in case mysql.hosts comes in piecemeal elif os-is-bootstrap-host; then # For multi node setups, start or re-bootstrap if we're the bootstrap host. # Shutdown MySql if running to pick up the new configuration, attempt # to join the cluster, and failing that, re-bootstrap. /etc/init.d/mysql stop /etc/init.d/mysql start || /etc/init.d/mysql bootstrap-pxc else # For multi node setups, restart if we're not the bootstrap host. # Shutdown MySql if running to pick up the new configuration /etc/init.d/mysql stop /etc/init.d/mysql start
deleted_lines: # For single node setups we can re-bootstrap if were not currently running # We need to ensure we are bootstrap host to prevent our regex succeeding # in case mysql.hosts comes in piecemeal if os-is-bootstrap-host && grep -Eq "^wsrep_cluster_address=gcomm://$LOCAL_IP,?\$" /etc/mysql/conf.d/cluster.cnf; then if ! /etc/init.d/mysql status; then

commit_message:
Reuse network resources in share-server creation test

In Tempest's test 'test_delete_share_server' were created isolated creds
without real need that causes redundant actions.
Use already existing network and subnet for this test with new share network,
because new share network is the only thing that is required by test.

Change-Id: I4d1902c4032d7a84d5193e894c7d72d3996155f5
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/manila refs/changes/30/147930/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Get network and subnet from existing share_network and reuse it # to be able to delete share_server after test ends. # TODO(vponomaryov): attach security-services if any exist for # donor share-network __, new_sn = self.create_share_network( neutron_net_id=self.share_network['neutron_net_id'], neutron_subnet_id=self.share_network['neutron_subnet_id']) __, share = self.create_share(share_network_id=new_sn['id']) search_opts = {"share_network": new_sn["id"]} __, servers = self.shares_client.list_share_servers(search_opts) resp, shares = self.shares_client.list_shares_with_detail(params) self.shares_client.delete_share(share["id"]) self.shares_client.wait_for_resource_deletion(share_id=share["id"]) resp, empty_list = self.shares_client.list_shares_with_detail(params) resp, server = self.shares_client.delete_share_server(servers[0]["id"]) self.shares_client.wait_for_resource_deletion(server_id=servers[0]["id"])
deleted_lines: # Get client with isolated creds client = self.get_client_with_isolated_creds() __, share = self.create_share(client=client) # Get share to be able to get its share_network_id __, share = client.get_share(share["id"]) search_opts = {"share_network": share["share_network_id"]} __, servers = client.list_share_servers(search_opts) resp, shares = client.list_shares_with_detail(params) client.delete_share(share["id"]) client.wait_for_resource_deletion(share_id=share["id"]) resp, empty_list = client.list_shares_with_detail(params) resp, server = client.delete_share_server(servers[0]["id"]) client.wait_for_resource_deletion(server_id=servers[0]["id"])

subject: Fix inconsistencies in the ComputeNode object about service
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-12-12 16:35:35.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/79b71e9eb3cc1e835046c0e5eeddebebc1ae436b', 'message': 'Fix inconsistencies in the ComputeNode object about service

DB API compute_node_get_by_service_id() was returning only the first
element even if there were multiple nodes per host. That left Ironic
the only possibility to access the full list of nodes by accessing the
compute property of the service DB object.
Fixed consequently get_all_by_host and get_by_host_and_nodename methods
which were buggy when providing backwards compatibility

Partially-Implements blueprint detach-service-from-computenode

commit_message:
Fix inconsistencies in the ComputeNode object about service

DB API compute_node_get_by_service_id() was returning only the first
element even if there were multiple nodes per host. That left Ironic
the only possibility to access the full list of nodes by accessing the
compute property of the service DB object.
Fixed consequently get_all_by_host and get_by_host_and_nodename methods
which were buggy when providing backwards compatibility

Partially-Implements blueprint detach-service-from-computenode

Change-Id: I51be99ca45e056cae26747892bd228565d7b03b7
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/20/141420/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def compute_node_get_by_service_id(context, service_id, use_slave=False): result = model_query(context, models.ComputeNode, read_deleted='no', use_slave=use_slave).\ all()
deleted_lines: def compute_node_get_by_service_id(context, service_id): result = model_query(context, models.ComputeNode, read_deleted='no').\ first()

commit_message:
Move heat-translator rtfd doc to openstack.org

The heat-translator project has recently moved to OpenStack from StackForge.
The rtfd hook doesn’t require anymore so removing/replacing it with
openstack-publish-jobs.

Change-Id: Iadc929cd3a8fe6e98e37b629802f9a46e67fe3f3

commit_message:
Remove pypy and py26 jobs from release-tools

The release tools aren't run under pypy or python 2.6, so we don't need
to take up test nodes for those tests.

Change-Id: I9f44b10be358a86980b99fc63af61670e354db96

commit_message:
Run trove-manage db_sync as database user

Without this specified it runs as root, which screws
up permissions.

Change-Id: I308b13edf12b18a686740c72fe305da82d205d25
Closes-Bug: #1411403

commit_message:
Update config location in project descriptions

The location of the configuration files for the jobs appears to have
been moved from
https://git.openstack.org/cgit/openstack-infra/system-config In
modules/openstack_project/files/jenkins_job_builder/config.  This
change updates the project descriptions to reflect that fact.

Change-Id: I1f8563f62e53b964984a29a79804889412e2e557

subject: libvirt: remove/revert pointless logic for getVersion call
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-12-10 15:06:18.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/6b5ff53e4cb91745add8d3832864ed4e6ffa2d4c', 'message': "libvirt: remove/revert pointless logic for getVersion call

A long time ago some wierd logic for the getVersion method
was added by this commit:

  commit 02db94dc33d72182201fd78651e5e5e82ab411c2
  Author: Justin Santa Barbara <justin@fathomdb.com>
  Date:   Wed Mar 23 01:22:11 2011 -0700

    Earlier versions of the python libvirt binding had getVersion
    in the libvirt namespace, not on the connection object.  Check
    both.

This commit was very confused & wrong. All libvirt versions have
provided a 'getVersion' method against *both* the 'libvirt'
package namespace and the libvirt.virConnect object namespace,
serving different purposes. The former gets the local library
version while the latter gets the remote daemon version. Neither
function has ever moved namespace.

Blueprint: libvirt-driver-class-refactor
Change-Id: I54ad7eb1cf03ae639d78a3e7f80e02d6c345aaf1
"}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2014-12-10 16:19:28.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/65f00d496c4f7633744b36925ef92d7efabe715f', 'message': "libvirt: remove/revert pointless logic for getVersion call

  commit 02db94dc33d72182201fd78651e5e5e82ab411c2
  Author: Justin Santa Barbara <justin@fathomdb.com>
  Date:   Wed Mar 23 01:22:11 2011 -0700

    Earlier versions of the python libvirt binding had getVersion
    in the libvirt namespace, not on the connection object.  Check
    both.

This commit was very confused & wrong. All libvirt versions have
provided a 'getVersion' method against *both* the 'libvirt'
package namespace and the libvirt.virConnect object namespace,
serving different purposes. The former gets the local library
version while the latter gets the remote daemon version. Neither
function has ever moved namespace.

Blueprint: libvirt-driver-class-refactor
Change-Id: I54ad7eb1cf03ae639d78a3e7f80e02d6c345aaf1

commit_message:
libvirt: remove/revert pointless logic for getVersion call

A long time ago some wierd logic for the getVersion method
was added by this commit:

  commit 02db94dc33d72182201fd78651e5e5e82ab411c2
  Author: Justin Santa Barbara <justin@fathomdb.com>
  Date:   Wed Mar 23 01:22:11 2011 -0700

    Earlier versions of the python libvirt binding had getVersion
    in the libvirt namespace, not on the connection object.  Check
    both.

This commit was very confused & wrong. All libvirt versions have
provided a 'getVersion' method against *both* the 'libvirt'
package namespace and the libvirt.virConnect object namespace,
serving different purposes. The former gets the local library
version while the latter gets the remote daemon version. Neither
function has ever moved namespace.

Blueprint: libvirt-driver-class-refactor
Change-Id: I54ad7eb1cf03ae639d78a3e7f80e02d6c345aaf1
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/24/140724/8 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: return self._conn.getVersion()
deleted_lines: # NOTE(justinsb): getVersion moved between libvirt versions # Trying to do be compatible with older versions is a lost cause # But ... we can at least give the user a nice message method = getattr(self._conn, 'getVersion', None) if method is None: raise exception.NovaException(_("libvirt version is too old" " (does not support getVersion)")) # NOTE(justinsb): If we wanted to get the version, we could: # method = getattr(libvirt, 'getVersion', None) # NOTE(justinsb): This would then rely on a proper version check return method()

commit_message:
libvirt: move capabilities helper into host.py

Move the get_host_capabilities method out of the driver.py
module into host.py, renaming it to get_capabilities

commit_message:
libvirt: move domain list helpers into Host class

Move the _list_instance_domains method and its associated
helpers into the Host class.

Blueprint: libvirt-driver-class-refactor
Change-Id: I90a782cc941d452e3de674e86ca18f802ca6902a
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/22/140722/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: @mock.patch.object(host.Host, "list_instance_domains") @mock.patch.object(host.Host, "list_instance_domains") @mock.patch.object(host.Host, "list_instance_domains") @mock.patch.object(host.Host, "list_instance_domains") @mock.patch.object(host.Host, "list_instance_domains") @mock.patch.object(host.Host, "list_instance_domains", @mock.patch.object(host.Host, "list_instance_domains") @mock.patch.object(host.Host, "list_instance_domains") mock.patch.object(host.Host, "list_instance_domains"),

FakeVirtDomain(id=3, name="instance00000001") vm2 = FakeVirtDomain(id=17, name="instance00000002") vm3 = FakeVirtDomain(name="instance00000003") vm4 = FakeVirtDomain(name="instance00000004") def fake_list_all(flags): vms = [] if flags & libvirt.VIR_CONNECT_LIST_DOMAINS_ACTIVE: vms.extend([vm1, vm2]) if flags & libvirt.VIR_CONNECT_LIST_DOMAINS_INACTIVE: vms.extend([vm3, vm4]) return vms self.mox.StubOutWithMock(libvirt_driver.LibvirtDriver, '_conn') libvirt_driver.LibvirtDriver._conn.listAllDomains = fake_list_all self.mox.ReplayAll() drvr = libvirt_driver.LibvirtDriver(fake.FakeVirtAPI(), False) doms = drvr._list_instance_domains_fast() self.assertEqual(len(doms), 2) self.assertEqual(doms[0].name(), vm1.name()) self.assertEqual(doms[1].name(), vm2.name()) doms = drvr._list_instance_domains_fast(only_running=False) self.assertEqual(len(doms), 4) self.assertEqual(doms[0].name(), vm1.name()) self.assertEqual(doms[1].name(), vm2.name()) self.assertEqual(doms[2].name(), vm3.name()) self.assertEqual(doms[3].name(), vm4.name()) def test_list_instance_domains_slow(self): vm1 = [vm1, vm2, vm3, vm4] def fake_get_domain_by_id(self, id): for vm in vms: if vm.ID() == id: return vm raise exception.InstanceNotFound(instance_id=id) def fake_get_domain_by_name(self, name): for vm in fake_list_ddoms(): # Include one name that no longer exists and # one dup from running list to show race in # transition from inactive -> running return [vm1.name(), vm3.name(), vm4.name(), "fishfood"] self.stubs.Set(host.Host, "get_domain_by_id", fake_get_domain_by_id) self.stubs.Set(host.Host, "get_domain_by_name", fake_get_domain_by_name) self.mox.StubOutWithMock(libvirt_driver.LibvirtDriver, '_conn') libvirt_driver.LibvirtDriver._conn.listDomainsID = fake_list_doms libvirt_driver.LibvirtDriver._conn.listDefinedDomains = self.assertEqual(doms[1].name(), vm2.name()) self.assertEqual(doms[2].name(), vm3.name()) self.assertEqual(doms[3].name(), vm4.name()) def test_list_instance_domains_fallback_no_support(self): vm1 = FakeVirtDomain(id=3, name="instance00000001") vm2 = FakeVirtDomain(id=17, name="instance00000002") vms = [vm1, vm2] def fake_get_domain_by_id(self, id): for vm in vms: if vm.ID() == id: return vm raise exception.InstanceNotFound(instance_id=id) def fake_list_doms(): return [vm1.ID(), vm2.ID()] def fake_list_all(flags): ex = fakelibvirt.make_libvirtError( libvirt.libvirtError, "API is not commit_message:
libvirt: move domain lookup helpers into Host class

Move the _lookup_by_id, _lookup_by_name and _get_domain
methods into the Host class.

Blueprint: libvirt-driver-class-refactor
Change-Id: I76f48a524ce4b46bf06233538b3fbe8f4f5fc5d2

commit_message:
Enable functional testing job for ironic-discoverd

tox -efunc is a simple in-place functional test that does not
require devstack or external dependencies. It mocks external
services and uses temporary files to simulate environment for
running the ramdisk.

Change-Id: I586c4236620cb4a94551322b982a6612dcfb6b49

commit_message:
Fix tempest test return value

Like the other data sources clients I changed recently, cinder now returns
just one value instead of two, causing our tempest test to crash.

This changes our tempest test to expect just one value from list_volumes().

Change-Id: I8f610c0ef40f078e8c501cd2b68cb208a155f73a

subject: Better name checking in jenkins project checks
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-01-16 23:23:05.000000000', 'files': ['tools/jenkins-projects-checks.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/project-config/commit/88a5492951d2953c7d8ebb40ad184545e338bef3', 'message': "Better name checking in jenkins project checks

Previously the check for ' name: ' was too relaxed and could match lines
that validly set a value for a macro. Make the check for 'name:' much
more restrictive to only match top level names in projects. This was you
can have macros that accept overridden name values without running into
trouble with alphabetization.

Change-Id: I16299f53433cdd1378ae6665399e3deb8a68d381
"}]
commit_message:
Better name checking in jenkins project checks

Previously the check for ' name: ' was too relaxed and could match lines
that validly set a value for a macro. Make the check for 'name:' much
more restrictive to only match top level names in projects. This was you
can have macros that accept overridden name values without running into
trouble with alphabetization.

Change-Id: I16299f53433cdd1378ae6665399e3deb8a68d381

commit_message:
Speed up __hash__() using tuples instead of repr

The previous version calculates the hash each time someone calls __hash__().
This version caches the hash value until the object changes.

Change-Id: I6df5000094893cd9dc9021f02edf633eeb9ff745

commit_message:
Move the neutron-dsvm-api job to the check queue

Also make sure it doesn't target any of the stable branches, since the
necessary configuration won't be available.

Also, remove a duplicate DEVSTACK_GATE_NEUTRON config line in the api
job config.

Change-Id: I5036f0687b621b14a005d166ebb3f10bd53e4fb2

prep_source_repos: Only run pep8 tests

Right now we don't have any tests to actually run. We need to get some;
but until we have some there's no point running the python-jobs.

commit_message:
Updated gerrit bot for new openstack-ansible branches

The project is presently working on becoming more generic. As such
we have replaced our old branches with new ones and would like to
have the gerrit bot updated to reflect the new branches.

New Branch Names:
  * icehouse
  * juno
  * kilo

Change-Id: I20f87b7107f45bcb094c97c87a0f576008dbd083

Change-Id: Ife7b6829f70d9fc9bd25419d45f45e86ff80b4fb

commit_message:
Ensure DB is provisioned before db-sync

This adds a dependency to ensure that the MySQL database is created
before attempting to run the neutron db-sync.

Change-Id: Ife7b6829f70d9fc9bd25419d45f45e86ff80b4fb
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/puppet-neutron refs/changes/98/147898/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Add a messagepack utils helper module

Messagepack is used by some projects, so providing a more
featureful encoding/decoding functionality that works better
with specialized types such as datetime, uuids and so-on in
a customized manner would be quite useful for those projects
that use it so they don't blow up when encoding and don't need
to resort to lossy serialization (by using jsonutils).

Change-Id: I295bfca0737301d15414410822bfbb28f66370dd
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/oslo.serialization refs/changes/53/147353/24 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Copyright (C) 2015 Yahoo! Inc. All Rights Reserved. # # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may # not use this file except in compliance with the License. You may obtain # a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT # WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. import datetime import itertools import uuid import msgpack from oslo.utils import importutils from oslo.utils import timeutils import six import six.moves.xmlrpc_client as xmlrpclib netaddr = importutils.try_import("netaddr") def _serializer(obj): if isinstance(obj, uuid.UUID): return msgpack.ExtType(10, six.binary_type(obj)) if isinstance(obj, datetime.datetime): return msgpack.ExtType(11, timeutils.isotime(at=obj)) if type(obj) == itertools.count: return msgpack.ExtType(12, six.binary_type(obj)) if netaddr and isinstance(obj, netaddr.IPAddress): return msgpack.ExtType(13, six.binary_type(obj)) if isinstance(obj, set): return msgpack.ExtType(14, dumps(list(obj))) if isinstance(obj, xmlrpclib.DateTime): obj = datetime.datetime(*tuple(obj.timetuple())[:6]) return msgpack.ExtType(15, timeutils.isotime(at=obj)) raise TypeError("Unknown type: %r" % (obj,)) def _unserializer(code, data): if code == 10: return uuid.UUID(data) if code == 11: return timeutils.parse_isotime(data) if code == 12: return itertools.count(int(data)) if netaddr and code == 13: return netaddr.IPAddress(data) if code == 14: return set(loads(data)) if code == 15: obj = timeutils.parse_isotime(data) return xmlrpclib.DateTime(obj.timetuple()) return msgpack.ExtType(code, data) def dumps(obj): return msgpack.packb(obj, default=_serializer) def loads(s): return msgpack.unpackb(s, ext_hook=_unserializer)

commit_message:
Switch to using 'oslo_utils' vs 'oslo.utils'

Prefer the non-deprecated 'oslo_utils' instead of
the namespaced 'oslo.utils' wherever it was previously
used.

Change-Id: I9a78150ef5266e1ff22147278162fe3cfe1b2e3f

commit_message:
Make setup.cfg packages include oslo.vmware

This properly deploys the oslo.vmware package may resolve
sphinx build errors for projects which have not yet
upgraded to oslo_vmware.

Change-Id: I4db750fb2356ebf44a8fccf7c422b474fefec0ee

Change-Id: I34d51b71c01df02bef46639149fde08f89f0e110
Signed-off-by: Paul Belanger <paul.belanger@polybeacon.com>
